Detailed Description

Represents a connection to a remote server for sending requests.

RemoteServer represents a single connection to a remote server, maintaining the connection for the life of the RemoteServer object. The connection is initially established, but the object stays valid in existence even if the remote server connection is closed.

Author:
Matt Brace

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

RemoteServer::RemoteServer ( std::string  serverAddress,
int32_t  serverPort 
)

Initializes internal data objects and establishes connection.

The initial connection is established in the constructor, however, the object stays valid even if the connection fails or is disconnected.

Parameters:
serverAddress a std::string indicating the address to connect to.
serverPort a 32 bit integer indicating the port on the remote server to connect.

bool RemoteServer::sendRequest ( int32_t  serviceId,
queueItem  item 
)

Sends a request to the associated remote server.

Sends a request for the specified service and item to the associated remote server.

Parameters:
serviceId a 32 bit integer indicating the id of the service to associate with the request.
item the queueItem to send to the remote server.
Returns:
true if the request was successful, false otherwise.
